column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.2
#Text=Array Preparation and Use in Hybridization Reactions
#Text=[0334] When compared to monolayer coverage of a support, a polymer coating on a glass microscope slide offers increased coupling capacity of the capture probes.
#Text=Toward this end, a support was prepared with a layer of neutral polymer up to 20 microns thick.
#Text=The polymer was an acrylamide based material doped with glycerol monomethacrylate.
#Text=When oxidized, the vicinol diols of the glycerol monomethacrylate were converted to aldehydes which served as anchor points for the amine-terminated oligonucleotide capture probes.
#Text=[0335] To anchor the polymer to the surface, the glass is first silanized with 3-(trimethoxysilyl)propyl methacrylate according to the procedure of S.
#Text=Savard, et al., "Hydrolysis and Condensation of Silanes in Aqueous Solutions," Polym Compos 5:242-249 (1984), which is hereby incorporated by reference.
#Text=A dilute aqueous HCl solution, pH 2-4, of 3-(trimethoxysilyl)propyl methacrylate (0.04 M) is vigorously stirred at 25.degree.
#Text=C. for 30 minutes.
#Text=Clean 3.times.1" microscope slides (prepared according to Example 8) are incubated with occasional agitation in this solution for 30 minutes at 25.degree.
#Text=The three edges supported by the shims are held in place with clamps leaving a one 1 inch edge of the microscope slide open.
#Text=The cavity thus formed is filled with a polymerizable solution containing N,N-dimethylacrylamide (0.9 M), glycerol monomethacrylate (0.1 M) (Polysciences, Inc.

#Text=Warrington, Pa.), N,N-methylene-bisacrylamide crosslinker (0.0027 M), with N,N,N',N', tetramethylethylenediamine (0.2% v/v) and freshly prepared 10% ammonium persulfate (2% v/v) to initiate polymerization.
#Text=The polymerization proceed for 30 min at 25.degree.
#Text=C., and the "sandwich" is disassembled.
#Text=The polymeric film is rinsed in deionized water, allowed to dry, and stored at 4.degree.
#Text=C. until further use.

#Text=[0337] As practiced in the aforementioned reference, a conventional protocol is used, employing oxidation with NaIO.sub.4 to generate an aldehyde in its gel form, a custom designed precursor copolymerized with N,N-dimethylacrylamide.
#Text=The aldehyde in the present invention is generated by treatment of the vicinol diol of glycerol monomethacrylate with NaIO.sub.4 (0.1 M, 25.degree.
#Text=C., 1 hour).
#Text=The aldehyde containing matrix is soaked in deionized water (1 hour, 25.degree.
#Text=C.).
#Text=The slides are removed from the bath, and excess water is blown off the hydrated surface with a stream of nitrogen.
#Text=The polymer is allowed to dry (30 minutes, 25.degree.
#Text=C.).

#Text=Using a 0.5 .mu.l capacity syringe, 0.1 .mu.l of a fluorescently labeled 24-mer capture oligonucleotide probe (500 .mu.M in 0.2 M sodium acetate buffer at pH .about.5) containing a primary, terminal amine is deposited onto the aldehydic surface.
#Text=One-tenth microliter of sodium cyanoborohydride (0.1 M) is deposited directly on top of the liquid containing the address.
#Text=The reductive amination is allowed to proceed for 24 hours in a humidity chamber (25.degree.
#Text=C.).
#Text=After the coupling reaction, the matrix is soaked in bicine buffer (300 mM, pH 8), containing 300 mM NaCl and 0.1% sodium dodecylsulfate for 30 min at 65.degree.
#Text=C.
#Text=The slides are rinsed in deionized water, blown dry with nitrogen and stored in a desiccator.
